alert.note: Alert for Giles; Hickman; Lawrence; Lewis; Marshall; Maury; Rutherford; Wayne; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 3:54PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lewis, northeastern Wayne, Marshall, northwestern Rutherford, northern Lawrence, Maury, Williamson, northern Giles and eastern Hickman Counties through 445 PM CST... At 354 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Centerville to 6 miles northeast of Collinwood. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Columbia, Lewisburg, Lawrenceburg, Pulaski, Hohenwald, Centerville, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Spring Hill, Nolensville, Mount Pleasant, Thompson`s Station, Summertown, Chapel Hill, Cornersville, Eagleville, Ethridge and Lynnville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 13 and 70. Interstate 24 between mile markers 64 and 69. Interstate 840 between mile markers 7 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for Middle Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Giles; Hickman; Lawrence; Lewis; Marshall; Maury; Rutherford; Wayne; Williamson
